2.text: “How long will you go on saying such things? The words of your mouth are a blustering wind.

3.text: Does God pervert justice? Does the Almighty pervert what is right?

4.text: When your children sinned against Him, He gave them over to their rebellion.

5.text: But if you would earnestly seek God and ask the Almighty for mercy,

6.text: if you are pure and upright, even now He will rouse Himself on your behalf and restore your righteous estate.

7.text: Though your beginnings were modest, your latter days will flourish.

8.text: Please inquire of past generations and consider the discoveries of their fathers.

9.text: For we were born yesterday and know nothing; our days on earth are but a shadow.

10.text: Will they not teach you and tell you, and speak from their understanding?

11.text: Does papyrus grow where there is no marsh? Do reeds flourish without water?

12.text: While the shoots are still uncut, they dry up more quickly than grass.

13.text: Such is the destiny of all who forget God; so the hope of the godless will perish.

14.text: His confidence is fragile; his security is in a spider’s web.

15.text: He leans on his web, but it gives way; he holds fast, but it does not endure.

16.text: He is a well-watered plant in the sunshine, spreading its shoots over the garden.

17.text: His roots wrap around the rock heap; he looks for a home among the stones.

18.text: If he is uprooted from his place, it will disown him, saying, ‘I never saw you.’

19.text: Surely this is the joy of his way; yet others will spring from the dust.

20.text: Behold, God does not reject the blameless, nor will He strengthen the hand of evildoers.

21.text: He will yet fill your mouth with laughter, and your lips with a shout of joy.

22.text: Your enemies will be clothed in shame, and the tent of the wicked will be no more.”
